step1.sentence: To survive, the startup had to compete in the market against well-funded rivals with years of brand recognition.

step2.story: Sarah's small bakery was struggling to compete in the market against the large chain stores nearby. She decided to focus on handmade quality and local ingredients to set herself apart. Slowly, loyal customers began choosing her shop over the competition.

step3.story: When Marcus launched his tech startup, everyone warned him it would be nearly impossible to compete in the market dominated by industry giants. Rather than feeling discouraged, he spent months studying the gaps those giants had left behind. He built a lean team, focused on a niche audience, and delivered a product that solved a problem the big players had ignored. Within two years, his company had carved out a loyal user base and attracted serious investor interest. Competing in the market had not just been possible — it had shaped him into a sharper, more resilient entrepreneur.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 시장 내에서 다른 기업이나 상품과 경쟁하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 비즈니스 환경에서 기업이 고객, 점유율, 또는 수익을 두고 다른 경쟁자들과 맞서는 상황을 표현할 때 사용한다. 신생 기업이나 소규모 사업체가 대형 경쟁자와 겨루는 맥락에서 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'compete'는 라틴어 'competere'(함께 추구하다)에서 유래했으며, 'market'은 라틴어 'mercatus'(거래, 상업)에서 왔다. 두 단어의 결합으로 상업적 경쟁이라는 현대적 의미가 형성되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 경쟁보다는 구조화된 시장 환경 속에서의 전략적 대결을 암시하며, 도전적이지만 진지한 비즈니스 맥락에서 사용된다. 긍정적 의지나 생존 본능을 내포하는 경우가 많다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Without cutting costs, we simply cannot compete in the market.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 비용을 절감하지 않으면 우리는 시장에서 경쟁할 수 없다.
